turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Ehrang station.
turn.1: What is special about Ehrang station?
turn.2: The entrance building, including the side buildings and the water tower, are listed under the Rhineland-Palatinate Monument Protection Act ("Denkmalschutzgesetz") as a cultural monument.
turn.3: What material was the water tower made of?
turn.4: The water tower is a spherical water tank, which was built on a cone-shaped base of cast iron plates between 1907 and 1913.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Today, the water tower is a relatively rare representative of the water towers built around 1900 to the "Intze" design.
turn.7: What kind of materials were the buildings made of?
turn.8: The ensemble of the entrance building, rail sheds and employees accommodation is a picturesque group building with red sandstone façades.
turn.9: What is the address of the station?
turn.10: The whole ensemble is listed at the address of "Ehranger Straße 2, 3, 4, 5, 7 and 8".
turn.11: How much do things cost to park there?
turn.12: The fares of the "Verkehrsverbundes Region Trier" (VRT) as well as the fares of Deutsche Bahn are valid on all public transport in Ehrang.
